entry.title: More thoughts on NOINPUT safety
entry.summary: In a conversation between aj and ZmnSCPxj, they discuss potential ways to simplify the Bitcoin script for Taproot. Aj proposes a shorter version of the current script, which ZmnSCPxj questions due to the use of OP_CODESEPARATOR. They also discuss the use of different shared keys in the two branches of the script and how signing with NOINPUT, NOSCRIPT and codeseparatorpos can enforce CLTV and allow binding to any prior update tx. Finally, they mention that there are two pubkeys, two sigs, and the taproot point reveal.
